messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Toys from Trash
messages.msgSnippet: I am from India. This site is parked in my favorites all through three computer crashes and reinstalls. I haunt this site. This is still incredible. Delighted
messages.messageBody:
I am from India. This site is parked in my favorites all through three
computer crashes and reinstalls. I haunt this site. This is still
incredible. Delighted to run into it again. Hadn't been here for months.

Never mind Nisarga, I'm having a blast exploring this site without waiting
for my guy to grow up :D All in the name of research ;)

Thanks for sharing.

Vidyut

On Wed, Feb 17, 2010 at 7:42 PM, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:

>
>
> This page is REALLY cool for a ton of reasons:
>
> http://www.arvindguptatoys.com/toys.html
>
> There are things that could easily be identified as science, math, art
> and music, but what's really cool is that the trash of the "toys from
> trash" name is all carefully photographed, and it's from India. This
> won't be exotic to the listmembers from India, but indulge the rest of
> us.
>
> There's a toothpaste-tube pump. I like looking at the toothpaste
> tube art better than thinking about making a pump! (There's a whole
> section on pumps there.)
>
> Sandra
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Toys from Trash
messages.msgSnippet: This page is REALLY cool for a ton of reasons: http://www.arvindguptatoys.com/toys.html There are things that could easily be identified as science, math, art
messages.messageBody:
This page is REALLY cool for a ton of reasons:

http://www.arvindguptatoys.com/toys.html

There are things that could easily be identified as science, math, art
and music, but what's really cool is that the trash of the "toys from
trash" name is all carefully photographed, and it's from India. This
won't be exotic to the listmembers from India, but indulge the rest of
us.

There's a toothpaste-tube pump. I like looking at the toothpaste
tube art better than thinking about making a pump! (There's a whole
section on pumps there.)

Sandra
